data.title: Aerospace Manufacturing
data.meta_description: Aerospace manufacturing news and insight, covering the design, production and supply chain of the civil and defence aerospace sectors.
data.text:
Meggitt signs Rolls Royce Spey engine part contract

Meggitt has signed a three-year contract with JACOM Trading for the supply of spare parts to the Rolls Royce Spey engine.

Meggitt signs up to UN’s Race to Zero campaign

Meggitt has signed up to the UN’s Race to Zero campaign, committing to achieving net zero carbon emissions by 2050 at the latest.

Meggitt signs another 737 MAX contract

Meggitt has signed a long-term, £multi-million agreement with Boeing for the supply of cockpit indicators on the 737 MAX. The contract covers a suite of cockpit indicators across all versions of the aircraft.

Meggitt secures SMARTSupport aftermarket contract

Meggitt has secured a three-year contract with Sichuan Services Aero-Engine Maintenance Company (SSAMC) to supply components for the CFM56 engine. The contract has a lifetime value of approximately $1 million.

Meggitt wins US Navy contract worth $27.4m

Meggitt has been awarded a follow-on, fixed-price contract valued at $27.4 million by the Naval Air Systems Command, Patuxent River, Maryland, for the supply of 32 liquid palletised cooling units for the P-8A aircraft. This consolidates a solid year of defence sales for Meggitt.

Meggitt wins radome contract for the Typhoon

Aerospace, defence and energy specialist Meggitt has secured a £4.2 million contract with BAE Systems for the supply of innovative nose radome technology on the Typhoon fighter.

Meggitt signs 3 year continuation contract with Northrop Grumman

Meggitt has received a three year continuation contract with Northrop Grumman for the supply of fuel bladders on the F/A-18 Super Hornet.

Meggitt signs $15m F-35 contract

Meggitt has signed a $15 million contract with Chemring Australia Pty, for the continued supply of flare countermeasure assemblies on the F-35 fighter jet.

Meggitt completes five year contract with GE Aviation

Meggitt has completed a multi-million dollar, five year contract extension with GE Aviation for the supply of valves, sensors and heat exchangers across a range of engine programmes.

Meggitt awarded $73-million contract by Bell Textron

Meggitt has signed a contract with Bell Textron for $73 million to supply composite de-icing propeller rotor blankets, heated spinners, fairings and pendulums to the Bell Boeing V-22 Osprey. The contract is valid for five years.

Meggitt announces HiETA Technologies investment

Meggitt (UK), a subsidiary of Meggitt PLC, a leading international company specialising in high performance components and subsystems for the aerospace, defence and selected energy markets, has announced an investment in HiETA Technologies, a UK company with world-leading capabilities in metal additive manufacturing.

Meggitt signs a six year fuel bladder contract worth £130m

Meggitt has signed a six year $130 million requirements contract with the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA), Philadelphia for the supply of fuel bladders.

Meggitt chosen for fuel bladder contract

Meggitt, a leading international company specialising in high performance components and subsystems for the aerospace, defence and selected energy markets, has been selected by Lockheed Martin to supply fuel bladders for its C130J Super Hercules platform.

Meggitt to expand carbon brake manufacturing facility in Kentucky

Meggitt has announced plans to expand its carbon brake manufacturing facility in Kentucky, marking a significant increase of both capability and capacity.

Meggitt secures $85m worth of military jet deals

Meggitt has announced two deals with an aggregated value of $85 million with Lockheed Martin and the Defence Logistics Agency in the US.

Meggitt expands aerospace services and support centre in Miami

Meggitt, which specialises in high performance components and subsystems for the aerospace, defence and selected energy markets, has opened its newly expanded aerospace services and support centre of excellence in Miami, Florida.

Meggitt signs Pratt & Whitney contract for the supply F135 and F119 parts

Meggitt has signed a long term agreement with Pratt & Whitney to continue the supply of advanced composite components for the F119 and F135 engines which power the F-22 Raptor and F-35 Lightning II aircraft.

Meggitt launches construction of new £130m facility in West Midlands

International aerospace, defence and energy engineering group Meggitt has commenced work on the construction of a new manufacturing and office facility at Ansty Park in Coventry.

Time to join the digital dots

Under the umbrella of digital manufacturing, Meggitt Applied Research & Technology Group’s graduate engineer - global programme, Theo Abbott investigates how knowledge gleaned from large-scale data capture in a flexible production environment can be applied to high value manufacturing.

Meggitt announces new partnership with the MTC

Meggitt PLC has announced it is now an Industrial Member of the Manufacturing Technology Centre (MTC) located at Ansty Park, Coventry.

Meggitt CEO, Young to retire: Wood appointed successor

Meggitt has announced that chief executive, Stephen Young has advised the Group of his intention to retire at the end of April 2018. Young has served as Meggitt’s chief executive for five years and, prior to that, for nine years as finance director.
